decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Doomsday combo to win the game. The deck includes cards that allow the player to manipulate their library, such as Brainstorm, Ponder, and Personal Tutor, in order to set up the perfect Doomsday pile. By combining cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Thassa's Oracle, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the player can win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by quickly establishing board presence and disrupting the opponent's strategy. Utilizing a blend of cheap removal spells, counterspells, and efficient creatures like Nethergoyf and Orcish Bowmasters, the deck aims to apply pressure while also protecting its own game plan. By using cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize, the deck can outmaneuver opponents and dictate the pace of the game, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck is focused on utilizing the Doomsday combo as its win condition. The key idea is to use spells like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, allowing the player to cast Doomsday and set up a winning pile of cards. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thassa's Oracle are key components in this strategy, ensuring the player can win the game once the Doomsday combo is executed. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' plays.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Mystic Forge combo in order to generate a powerful board advantage and potentially win the game. By using cards like Karn, the Great Creator, Urza's Saga, and Urza's Workshop, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and play multiple artifacts to take advantage of Mystic Forge's ability to cast cards from the top of the library. The deck also includes cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal for additional ramp, while including disruption cards like Pithing Needle and Portable Hole to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy involves using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga to generate card advantage and mana acceleration, while Chalice of the Void and Pithing Needle disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board with efficient creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Patchwork Automaton, while using cards like Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck's synergy with artifacts and efficient mana usage is the core strategy.

This Bant Control deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage, counterspells, and removal spells. It utilizes powerful cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats, while also having access to cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key cards. The deck also includes powerful win conditions like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. With a mix of board control, card advantage, and powerful threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponents in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while still maintaining a strong board presence to close out the game quickly. The deck also utilizes the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value and versatility. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently disrupt the opponent's strategy and quickly close out the game through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and removal while utilizing Stoneforge Mystic to tutor up powerful equipment like Batterskull. Murktide Regent and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide threats on the battlefield, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler offer card advantage and additional control options. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Daze and Stifle to keep opponents off balance. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands for consistency and access to all required colors. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a grindy control matchup.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control through utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, while also leveraging powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. Stoneforge Mystic is used to tutor up powerful equipment like Batterskull or Sword of Fire and Ice to further enhance the deck's control abilities. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and utility, while Quantum Riddler offers additional control options. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and grind out incremental advantages to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources while deploying efficient threats to control the pace of the game. It utilizes a mix of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Snuff Out to disrupt the opponent's plans. The creatures in the deck like Baleful Strix and Murktide Regent provide pressure and help maintain tempo. With the help of counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to keep the opponent off balance and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to lock down the opponent's mana base while ramping up damage quickly. By utilizing cards like Blood Moon and Molten Collapse to disrupt the opponent's lands, and creatures like Barrowgoyf and Pyrogoyf to apply pressure, the deck aims to close out games swiftly. With Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide speeding up the mana curve, and cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker providing additional threats, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt opponents' strategies while Cavern of Souls ensures that your Eldrazi spells can't be countered. The Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin provide additional mana acceleration and search capabilities. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive Eldrazi creatures while using disruption spells like Kozilek's Command to control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent's life total by playing efficient threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland, allowing the aggro strategy to push through for a quick victory. The deck's versatility and synergy between its cards make it a powerful force in the Legacy format, capable of outpacing and outmaneuvering opponents.

mainboard.name: Vito, Thorn of the Dusk Rose

decks.notes: This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Barrowgoyf and Bloodthirsty Conqueror, using mana acceleration from cards like Chrome Mox and Dark Ritual. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Exsanguinator Cavalry and Sheoldred's Edict to control the board. The deck's key strategy is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures and spells, utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Sorin of House Markov and Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord to help push damage through. The deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize or set up their own game plan.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and spells utilizing various fast mana sources and rituals to cheat out a win condition such as Thassa's Oracle or Poxwalkers. By using cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy to mill the deck, the deck can quickly win by triggering cards like Narcomoeba or Dread Return. The goal is to win before the opponent can establish a board presence or disrupt the combo, making it a high-risk, high-reward strategy that requires careful planning and timing.

The main concept of this Legacy Control - Pox deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources and board state through a combination of land destruction, discard spells, and targeted removal. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Smallpox, Sinkhole, and Vindicate to disrupt the opponent's mana base and key threats. Karn, Scion of Urza and Liliana of the Veil provide additional value and card advantage, while cards like Trinisphere and Crucible of Worlds help to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of powerful lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Karakas adds additional layers of control to the deck.
